channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Glass and cigarette butts, 2nd October
item.description:
Shattered glass bits on pavement outside the newsagents and charity shop and bottle shop in Pickford lane. Lots of cigarette butts outside Londis aka Browns newsagents. The pavements are s mess. The litter pickers don’t sweep the pavements or pick litter near the charity shop, Lees hairdressers. I’m constantly picking up litter here!
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Pickford Lane, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: People putting rubish in the bins for flats, 2nd October
item.description:
The neighbours around here seemed to think they can use our bins for their rubbish so every time we try to put our rubbish out properly someone has already filled up our bins making it very difficult for the people who live in the flats to recycle and keep the bins in proper order

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Abbotts Close, Thamesmead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Report 2 of 2: A fitness company advertisement on an A4 wooden board has been deposited on the ground by the inset railings to the right of the park operatives' vehicle gate in Croydon Rd Rec (aka Beckenham Recreation Ground) near Whitmore Rd and the petrol station, 2nd October
item.description:
Report 2 of 2: A fitness company advertisement on an A4 wooden board has been deposited on the ground by the inset railings to the right of the park operatives' vehicle gate in Croydon Rd Rec (aka Beckenham Recreation Ground) near Whitmore Rd and the petrol station. Please check the other 6 or so park gates and grounds generally for other deposited or flyposted advertisements which create physical and visual clutter in this lively, historic public recreation ground.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croydon Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3of3: Fronting The Knoll flats, 14, Shortlands Rd, Shortlands, ten residents' wheely bins have been left as an obstruction and eyesore on the public footway rather than being returned to the residential bin store., 2nd October
item.description:
3of3: Fronting The Knoll flats, 14, Shortlands Rd, Shortlands, ten residents' wheely bins have been left as an obstruction and eyesore on the public footway rather than being returned to the residential bin store. The bins are empty so presumably this is the responsibility of a Veolia operative. In this case, I recall the bins being left on the footway by residents on the nights before the day of collection, I think.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Shortlands Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
